review_title: Pays better than most in the area, but…..
job_title: Registered Nurse Care Manager in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Good pay, bonus is good
cons: Hmmmm. can’t think of anything

job_title: School Based Therapist in Wentzville, MO
pros: This company is a great company to work for. Plenty of potential to move up,pay increases,bonuses etc. They actually listed to what their employees have to say and make changes accordingly.
cons: The PTO is just average. Being a mental health facility I feel like there should be more PTO since working in this field can be emotionally draining. There are no sick days. You have to use your PTO. So, if you are sick for a week and use all your PTO then no vacation for you that year. I feel it’s a big con bc the company should be setting an example of how important self care is and to utilize it for that and no being sick or forced to use PTO when it snows or the roads have ice.

job_title: Youth Specialist I in Camdenton, MO
pros: I worked for Compass for 1 year before resigning: supportive supervisor great co-workers caring therapist you can be a great support for the youth pay is good, work life balance is good
cons: quotas are unreasonable for rural areas with youth. drive time to the client's home was not counted per hour quota cancellation by family hurt quotas saw amazing co-worker who truly cared for children be fired over the new quota Initially, I loved the job but when Compass and Pathways merged and the new quota started, I became more concerned about the numbers so I wouldn't get fired vs my prior focus was just helping youth. To meet quota, I felt I was wasting time of the youth and family. Billing insurance seemed to be the primary focus for Compass, this is how it felt as an employee. I felt a dime a dozen as I watched staff get fired, people who had been there years and really made a difference.

job_title: Addiction Recovery Technician in Warrensburg, MO
pros: Great mental health support for employees, excellent behavioral health experience, passionate staff, good pay, and an inclusive work atmosphere.
cons: Within the in-patient facilities, it can be difficult to find a shift replacement if needed. You may also be called in frequently. However, I loved this position and didn't mind coming in on my days off.

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Raymore, MO
pros: Great coworkers Fair pay Gas reimbursement
cons: Client quota Management Work/life balance Unrealistic expectations

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Troy, MO
pros: Job security and as long as you manager your time you have no issues
cons: This role is the catch all for tasks and expectations to be met for grants and so expectations are always changing in regards to paperwork

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Columbia, MO
pros: great benefits good work environment
cons: no cons to think of

job_title: PSR, Team Lead in Washington, MO
pros: Flexibility. Relaxed environment. Diversity. Supportive coworkers.
cons: Some stressful days. One Saturday a month. Conflict amongst clients.

job_title: IHS in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Flex time, bonuses, decent benefits
cons: Upper management does not understand the challenges we face in the field

job_title: OP Therapist in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Good salary Decent benefits Most holidays off
cons: Corporate atmosphere Money is the motivating factor Too many clients and overwhelming paperwork. Reviews and rewards are based on performance re: how many people you see equals how many dollars they get.

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Wentzville, MO
pros: You will receive decent pay.
cons: IHSs are overworked and responsible for too many people and too much paperwork.

review_title: Mental Health is NOT the priority
job_title: Corporate Recruiter in Raymore, MO
pros: Good pay, decent benefits, lots of "perks"
cons: Unorganized, siloed business that does not seem to know who should be doing what. Nothing is standard and they try to sell it as "make it your own"

job_title: IHS in Lebanon, MO
pros: Good start pay. Nature of job.
cons: Pay not enough to offset stress, secondhand trauma, and contracting illness from clients. Required number of billable hours and clients per week makes it very difficult to get all documentation done in 24 hours for each client seen. 40 hours a week flex time they said but any week day not rendered 8 hours will be deducted off of PTO, even if you achieve your 40 hour work week and CCR for the week.

job_title: Nurse Care Manager in Sullivan, MO
pros: -care about their workers -excellent pay -flexibility -close knit
cons: -sometimes communication between departments is poor.

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Not a bad starting job
cons: Not a very supportive culture

job_title: IHSS Social Worker in Wentzville, MO
pros: Decent pay Make your own schedule
cons: Company has unrealistic goals and only cares about money

job_title: QUALIFIED MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONAL in Raymore, MO
pros: Great bonus incentives Can flex your own hours
cons: Needs more structured leadership and training

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Warrensburg, MO
pros: Coworkers, the connections made with clients is amazing, the feeling when a client tells you how much you’ve impacted them is incredible.
cons: They don’t care about your or your client’s mental health, communication is a joke, CCR is unreasonable, workload is always insane and more just gets added on while other departments (ACT / TAY) have their assessments and wellness plans done for them, share a caseload, and make $1 extra. They deserve it, but so does CPRC. You are not safe from possible harm ever, you’ll have clients be very inappropriate to you and you’ll still be expected to work with them. You have to report if you’re feeling unsafe and AND WAIT for emergency services to call you, twice. You’re not protected from bed bugs as you’ll be laid off and have to pay for it yourself, PTO is abysmal, no paid sick time, no mental health days, accessing services for you or your family is a joke, insurance is awful, no guarantee to always work from home, the office doesn’t close due to weather, you’ll be DENIED leave without pay and you can’t just call in without using PTO or making the time up, no one will listen to your concerns, and they’ll destroy your passion for this field, and you’re expected to put your job ahead of everything else while having “compassion fatigue” shoved down your throat. This place is a joke.

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Rolla, MO
pros: Freedom to make your own day to day schedule
cons: Poor management and lack of direction

job_title: School Based Therapist in Kansas City, MO
pros: Lots of great training opportunities
cons: Difficulty communicating through leadership levels

review_title: Pays better than most in the area, but…..

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Warsaw, MO
pros: The best thing about working for Compass is they have excellent training in person and online. If you choose to work for Compass be prepared for tons of training. This gets to be burdensome when you're trying to complete other work but is necessary to ensure that you are stating competent in your field of expertise.
cons: The worst part of working for Compass is they tell you they have company vehicles you can use but they are almost never available when you need to use them. This means that you have to use your own vehicle to transport clients all over the place. If your car insurance company finds out you're doing this, they will want to drop you or charge you a fortune.

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Flexible hours, good pay and benefits, PTO Accural
cons: Short deadlines, High caseloads and high expectations to meet quotas

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Good pay and benefits. Great coworkers and a lot of support.
cons: Technology is frustrating. High stress job with constant challenges.

review_title: Good pay & Benefits, Unrealistic expectations and Corporate pressure is unreal.

pros: Good pay, good benefits, opportunities to advance your career. AMAZING work family in regards to other Integrated Health Specialists.
cons: Unrealistic productivity demands pertaining to client case load. Example, must have x amount of hours of face to face time with clients and see x amount of people per week. Even if you clients are refusing to meet or are sick etc etc. Higher management always breathing down the necks of immediate supervisors which bleeds onto the integrated health specialists.

impact lives

job_title: Employment Specialist in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Good pay. No weekends. The company actually cares about their employees.
cons: It can be very stressful. The training process is very lacking.

job_title: Customer Relations Specialist in Jefferson City, MO
pros: My direct supervisor and manager were very understanding and supportive. When issues arose due to my work life, I always felt like I could reach out to both of them about it. They were also flexible and did not try to micromanage and control every single detail in our office.
cons: Unfortunately, the other leadership in other departments within the company were the complete opposite. There were leaders that micromanaged the therapists, for example. They also demanded a lot from them and had them take on caseload after caseload and worked them to the point where, most of them would quit. I think one of the biggest problems was that CEO of the company, did not seem like he cared too much about the people within his organization. When he would go into a building he wouldn’t even acknowledge the faces at the front, and would instead put all his focus on his phone.

review_title: Needed position, great first role out of grade school

pros: Good mission. Caring colleagues too.
cons: Tediousness with the notes, documentation & billing. High turnover rate which frustrates families and schools.

job_title: Supervisor in Warsaw, MO
pros: The only good thing is the clients. They consistently screw them over too .
cons: I gave them 3 years of loyal employment and realized they are all about the money. They will find a reason to not pay out vacation and quarterly bonuses. You can request to talk to someone but they are all on the same page. Upper management is more like a mean girls club than management.

pros: Flexible work hours with the opportunity to help individuals who suffer from mental illness and substance use disorders. You get reimbursed for mileage and supported by a team of great clinicians who are always willing to help.
cons: You basically work out of your car and drive most of the day to various clients. It is required to have the COVID vaccination.

job_title: School Based Therapist in Harrisonville, MO
pros: Opportunities for advancement, free training, love collaborating with my coworkers. I also have a lot of flexibility in hours and the type of work I can do. They have tuition reimbursement and contribute to HSA and 401k!
cons: Policies change frequently, it can be hard to keep up with sometimes.

review_title: Good pay, good benefits, lacks leadership

job_title: Human Resources Data Management Specialist Lead in Clinton, MO
pros:
Compass Health is a great company to work for. They try to accommodate their employees to allow them to work. Point in case, the COVID outbreak and CHN working hard to allow their employees to work from home.
They recognize the potential of their employees. They also recognize if an employee doesn't fit in a certain area and work to get them somewhere that they do belong within the company.
cons: I'm unable to come up with any cons for my position.

job_title: IHS in Saint Charles, MO
pros: Pay was better than most, managers cared
cons:
Incredibly numbers-focused. Was among the very few on my team to get my raise. For those who didn't, it often wasn't a lack of work ethic or capability at all. I do not recommend this workplace to anyone who is not committed to sacrificing quality of care to appease upper management's focus on productivity.

Though I can't confirm this, a manager once told me one of the higher ups said if people didn't like it, they could leave because "it's a business." This is certainly reflected in the way they approached employee incentives and benefits.

job_title: Peer Support Specialist in Columbia, MO
pros: Let me know when there are some. Not a good "recovery" environment.
cons: Lots of promises never fulfilled to staff or clients. Lack of training, communication and pay. No real resources to help clients other than get them rides or food. No actual "team" everyone just did what ever. Not a good place for a peer specialist. As a case worker they throw lots of money at you.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Columbia, MO
pros: You get paid well while you're there.
cons: You probably won't be there very long.

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Raymore, MO

job_title: CPRC Supervisor in Wentzville, MO
pros: My Coworkers are amazing, my direct supervisor is awesome, I love the population we serve and making a difference in our community. After hearing horror stories of toxic work environments from my partner and close friends, I am very grateful to feel validated, respected, heard, and valued in my position at Compass.
cons: Lots of changes to work flow, job tasks (additions), disconnect with upper management with direct care workers and supervisors, work life balance can be a challenge if you do not set firm boundaries

job_title: Adult CPRC Supervisor in Nevada, MO
pros: Solid team environment with great mid level management. Excellent pay for a social work/mental health agency. Continual opportunity for growth, promotion and CEUs.

review_title: Great pay and benefits, stressful work requirements

cons: They do everything they can to bully you into submission and work under the "because I said so" theme. They do their best not to pay you what your owed and you can forget about taking your pto. They also.wont pay you out your pto when you leave.

review_title: Better and Better -- at times yes
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Charles, MO
pros: It can be a positive and life changing place to work overall.  Crider has amazing providers who are willing to go above and beyond for their clients.  I witness this almost daily.  I have a great supervisor, who is there to assist me usually.  It is a wonderful place to gain experience and learn about healthcare.  There is holistic approach to healing the whole person - which is a great ideal to promote.
cons:
Communication is lacking in most areas/programs.  Ineffective communication occurs even on the same floor.  Also, management makes too many changes and they do not adequately think out the whole process before leaping into projects or significant program changes (co-pays for clients).  

LPCs are not able to provide counseling/therapy services nor do they get a stipend for any ongoing training to make them more valuable to the company.
    
Clients who are indigent and/or with no insurance are limited to being on a lengthy wait list for primary care, counseling, psychiatry, etc. due to limited funding resources - which at times is disheartening to relay to people in need of help.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Peters, MO
pros: Seek feedback from employees through multiple channels. Innovative and progressive in approach to care for customers. Continually improving to be a recognized provider and employer of choice.
cons: No organization is perfect, but Compass is open to learning and growing through experiences and from feedback received.

job_title: Medical Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: They pay more than most places in town.
cons: They don’t pay enough for the work they want you to do especially if you’re at the bottom of the food chain.

job_title: Behavioral Health Nurse in Wentzville, MO
pros: Great work life balance. Weekends off, hoildays off.
cons: The manager currently over my area mirco manages everything, it can be stressful keeping up with the mintunes that need to be charted daily.

job_title: IHS in Kansas City, MO
pros: Great team members. Very helpful.

review_title: Laid back and easy paced job but inconsistency with program rules,
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Clinton, MO
pros: Compensation, environment, takes employee mental health seriously

review_title: Use to be an amazing company to work for...
job_title: Outpatient Nurse in Saint Charles, MO
pros: Decent pay but you will be overworked, yearly bonus (dependent on funding), M-F (Saturday schedule added right before COVID & to be added back after precautions are lifted), paid holidays, and one paid personal day a year.
cons:
Management makes decisions and implements changes without having a clue as to how the clinic is actually run, causing disorganization, anxiety, confusion, a highly stressful environment, overwhelmed burnt-out employees, and a decrease in effective patient care. 
Immediate supervisors/management lack people skills and empathy, create a hostile work environment, they're unprofessional, passive-aggressive, and borderline harassing with their micromanagement. 
Lack of trust with immediate supervisors/management; no safe avenue to autonomously report or voice concerns without fear of reprisal. 
Lack of proper communication; rules, procedures and expectations change almost daily and are communicated through an overwhelming amount of emails that you are expected to remember and follow. Sometimes those changes you only learn of by word of mouth. Schedules are changed (quite often) without proper notification, the notification is sent to your work email (that you only have access to AT WORK) so you find out that you had a patient at 7:45 am as you are walking through the doors at 8 am putting the doctor behind.
This past year and a half, the high turnover rate for front office staff, nurses, and doctors should indicate some major issues but management feels that they know it all and believe that the employees "should be grateful" for the incentives Compass provides and should suck it up and just fall in line or else.

job_title: Counselor in Fulton, MO
pros: they pretend to be nice to you
cons: they work you until you cant work any more and then make it out to be your fault

review_title: Good for Traines, Not a great long term job
job_title: Outpatient Therapist in Eldon, MO
pros: Great place to learn to work with a variety of clients. You can qualify for tuition repayment at some rural locations, check with the National Health Service. It can be busy, but it's an easy job for an experienced therapist. You are never on call, not required to work evenings or weekends. No in home therapy. They provide out of office training but you have to advocate for yourself.
cons: The pay is low, at last 5,000-8,000 lower than similar not for profit surrounding companies. CEO is aware, but no current plans to increase salaries. Most offices are in poor condition (no windows, dirty, falling apart). Therapists have to buy their own supplies, if you see children this can get expensive. Your success is measured by how many hours you bill, not client progress or satisfaction.

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Saint Charles, MO
pros: Amazing direct supervisors, cohesive team, fulfilling work, competitive pay for case management
cons: Unrealistic expectations for CCR, uppers not listening to supervisors advocating for us doing the  fieldwork, not enough PTO, little opportunity for advancement unless a supervisor quits, not enough time in the day for CCR and required documentation

job_title: Therapist in Saint Charles, MO
pros: Tuition reimbursement with the state is the #1 reason people choose to work here & that’s great. The job is fine. You are treated fine, left alone to work as you want. There are bonuses.
cons: Poorly trained and overly worked managers try to run the place. There’s way too much paperwork. The client load is a bit high but doable. The rewards are hardly motivating for extra effort but if you’re a newbie you won’t find a better steady paycheck with better hours.

review_title: A job where you would like to make a difference, but are hamstrung by the company.
job_title: Children's Integrated Health Specialist in Troy, MO
pros: Good supervisor, supportive team, good networking
cons: Unreasonable expectations for employees, toxic positivity in the work environment, refusal to listen to workers on the ground, dishonest and manipulative corporate atmosphere focused on appearance rather than care.

review_title: Get paid to do what I love
job_title: Supervisor in Eldon, MO
pros: Flexible schedule, coworker support, nominations and acknowledgments of quality work, multiple benefits and competitive salary, able to use creativity, supported to enhance education and opportunities to continue your education, treatment team approach and client centered which results in positive connections, bonus incentives for doing your job tasks, promotes healthy living with staff along with patients, provides supplies for the job, food get together socials with staff, all day open access to support patients/clients schedules
cons: If I had cons, I wouldn’t be employed with them. I don’t need my job, I enjoy my job.

job_title: Outpatient Therapist in Raymore, MO
pros:
The money is the best thing about them.
Most of the clients really appreciate you and your help.
cons:
Management does not have time to train you properly. You are expected to learn things on your own. But when you don't do something correctly you get written up. They also don't want to hear of anything that might improve a process.
There is poor communication from the top down.
They waste a lot of money and resources. There is inconsistency agency wide.

job_title: CPRC Supervisor in Waynesville, MO
pros: Lots of flexibility in terms of working and raising a family. Supportive work environment. Great management. They promote from within. The company philosophy is client centered. Overall a great place to work.
cons: The company spans Missouri and parts of Louisiana. It is divided between multiple different regions with different management.  There are vast differences between different regions in terms of how things are done. It can be confusing to clients and employees who move from one service area to another. Also, pay is relatively low however this is a non-profit so pay will be commensurate.

job_title: CSS in Nevada, MO
pros: Flexible work hours, relatively flexible job duties, good people, good benefits, company supplies your with a nice phone for free or you can purchase a brand new one by making reasonable payments, nice laptops to work on, phones have reasonably good connection for travelling, you get company vehicles to drive which saves your own.
cons: Not the best salary, not the best work environment ergonomically speaking, it's quite noisy and you will not have your own office so it's hard to find a quiet place to finish your notes, lots of petty women gossip due to not being kept busy enough plus some work drama, lots of pressure to achieve a certain productivity percentage and writing your notes to be medicaid compliant, big brother watching over your shoulder constantly due to lack of trust from supervisors in their staff, sometimes you can get a horrible supervisor who constantly breathes down your neck to make sure you're crossing your T's and dotting your i's so to speak.....too much pressure to get that percentage and not enough clients to help you get your daily quota. This company also has very poor communication despite all this hand dandy fancy equipment and tracking devices they give you. Oh, btw, forgot to mention that this company does track your every move, including when where and how often you use the bathroom daily.  Seriously.  If you are up to big brother watching your every move then I say go for it, otherwise, find another job.  They will hire relatively quickly and fire relatively quickly as well.  Beware.  Good luck.  I tried to transfer to another office due to personality conflict between myself and my supervisor but the supervisor I had refused to allow me to transfer.  There was SO much stress for me and discrimination, as well.  I was there a year.  This company values more sales than it does quality client care, in my opinion.

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Wentzville, MO
pros: Flexible schedule. Supportive staff. Localized clientele. Benefits package (Medical, dental, vision. 401k, etc)
cons: Caseloads can be heavy and difficult. Home/work balance is difficult to manage. Micromanaging. There is little leeway for documentation not being completed (despite lack of compliance from clients).  Expectation of a minimal number of meetings per week, and reprimand if that number is not met.

job_title: Case Management in San Diego, CA
pros: An amazing opportunity to work with client with severe mental illness, coworkers are often supported, field base amazing opportunity to see how broken the mental health system is.
cons: Management is horrible! They treat their workers very poorly and pay them worse. It is very clear that the focus is on profits and not on the clients. They don't pay you the overtime that you have to work in order to meet their ridiculous standards for productivity and documentation.

job_title: Outpatient Clinician in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Absolutely great doctors to work with, who are some of the best psychiatrists around.
cons: Management is unrealistic regarding productivity, caseload, blames, and has favorites so prepare to be excluded. Human Resources also baits and switches regarding referral bonuses, they are not transparent.

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Warrenton, MO
pros: Best place I've ever worked. The bosses are caring, understanding, and most everyone in the company started at the bottom. Amazing benefits. I really enjoy my co-workers. Everyone is incredibly friendly. I love my job. I am happy to go to work everyday and I hear it from many others.
cons: I've been here over a year and the worst I can say is that it gets busy, but, to me, that isn't bad.

review_title: Great place to build your career!
job_title: Manager in O'Fallon, MO
pros: Flexible work schedule, Manager who is supportive and a mentor, lots of opportunity for advancement, and just an all around great environment to work in.
cons: Sometimes can be slow to change, at times it seems like there are too many cliques, and I wish they had more employee programs such as day care, a gym, a walking track, maybe a cafeteria.

job_title: Therapist in Clinton, MO
pros: Opportunity for growth, regular continued education offered, friendly coworkers, quality providers, integrated healthcare approach, opportunity for student loan repayment
cons: Large organization with some growing pains that come with working in a more progressive forward thinking CMHC

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Raymore, MO
pros: Flexible schedule/hours, good compensation during pandemic.
cons: A lot of micromanaging in the form of: mileage reports, tracking apps, checking in and out on app all day, etc. There are so many rules it is hard to keep track and team members are always worried they are doing things wrong or are going to get fired due to that. Offices spaces are tiny and packed full of other employees.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Wentzville, MO
pros: Great mission and vision. Direct care staff are great and compassionate about the work they do with an underserved population.
cons: Responsibilities are excessive and more than what one person can reasonably be expected to do. Salary is sub-par for volume of job responsibilities. Volume more important than quality. Repeated pattern of losing talent.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Charles, MO
pros: Develop friendly relationships with the residents.  Really good benefits & bonuses given out twice a year.  Money received on your birthday & double time for hol8days. Earn a dollar extra an hr if work weekends.  Annual yearly performance  raises. Available to apply to different positions in the company
cons: No holidays off unless you find coverage for your shift.  Not a lot of overtime available

review_title: Not a bad place to work
job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Flexible Schedules
Work at your own pace
Make a difference in your community
cons:
Management has unrealistic goals/expectations
Wear and Tear on your vehicle
Training is not helpful

review_title: Social Services work is former job.
job_title: Support Specialist in Warsaw, MO
pros: Really enjoying helping people, especially the mentally challenged and making their life more enjoyable. Helping them mix with the community.
cons: Loss of family time and low salary. Sacrificing self for others need. Convincing community of clients need to intermingling with community.

review_title: Not the best company to work for
job_title: Lead Addiction Recovery Technician in Warrensburg, MO
pros:
They promote internal hiring.
Plenty of jobs available.
Great place to gain experience.
cons:
High job overturn.
Underpaid.
Not the greatest benefits.
Doesn't look out for the clients.

job_title: Nurse in Springfield, MO
pros: Lots of training and education
cons:
Worst place I've ever worked for time off package!
Management very negative; management only talks to you to gripe; don't look for any praises for a good job done, it won't happen here

job_title: School-Based Mental Health Specialist in Wentzville, MO
pros: Somewhat of a flexible schedule
cons: Shadow for months and when you ask the person you are shadowing they are told by management not to answer questions.

job_title: Community Support Specialist in Sunrise Beach, MO
pros: Great and helpful coworkers, flexibility, paid time off, and holidays are among the enjoyable parts of the job. Direct supervisors are supportive and encouraging.
cons: Continuously changing policy, unfair management practices, unhelpful or supportive management, unbelievably low pay for the difficulty of the job and expectations.

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Saint Charles, MO
pros: supervisors are supportive, lots of lots of learning opportunities; the job is rewarding. Great job for entry level staff who want to know more about mental health
cons: too much driving; at least 40 miles per day; work late because most of the kids are available after 3pm

job_title: Addiction Recovery Technician in Columbia, MO
pros: Being able to have a positive impact on those who have initially lost hope. Watching them regain hope is a magical experience!
cons: There are a few bad eggs in the bunch that can suck the enjoyment right out of your soul...

job_title: Community Support Specialist in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Make your own schedule, working with the clients is super rewarding, good experience in the field.
cons: Pay, productivity over quality care, keeping up with paperwork that isn't counted for productivity, competing for productivity.

job_title: IHS in Jefferson, AR
pros: Love working with the clients
cons: They play politics with Childrens Division and Justice Juvenile Center. I was fired for standing against these 2 enities. They turn their head on a lot of bad things so, they can keep their contract with Missouri CD

review_title: Css help people with mental and physical health recover
job_title: CSS in Raymore, MO
pros: Flexibility, benefits include educational reimbursement, cell phones and fleet cars, great coworkers, supportive supervisors, agency has anonymous reporting system, can work hours I want,
cons: Low pay, dirty homes, lack of transportation in community

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Warrensburg, MO
pros:
Continuing education and training regularly, 
team work, family oriented, great benefits and work environment, opportunity for job growth
cons:
High expectations,
Difficult clients / job duties,
frequently changing, micromanagement, hard to make quotas with large amounts of paperwork

job_title: Community Support Specialist in Windsor, MO
pros: Most of the clients are great
cons:
Lack of training
Poor management
Poor supervisor, didn't know what they were doing
Had to drive my own car
Wasn't paid enough for what was asked
Clients were ungrateful
Old computers
Laptops didn't always work

review_title: good experience for starting in the field
job_title: Addiction Recovery Technician in Columbia, MO
pros: amazing clients and coworkers, good experience for college students, recent grads, or people without degrees that want to work in human services
cons: management is disconnected, low pay, low funding, understaffed

review_title: BEST JOB EVER!  I am truly blessed to be where I am!!  I am thankful everyday!
job_title: Marketing Associate in Saint Peters, MO
pros: Appreciated, Supported, Great Senior Management , and Supervisors!
cons: There are NO CONS for me

job_title: Psychiatric RN in Nevada, MO
pros: Great benefits. Friendly environment. Clean environment.
cons: Need to  have better electronic records for outpatient clinic efficiency. Too many supervisors.

job_title: Tss in East Stroudsburg, PA
pros: Flexible, taxs, paid travel /training
cons: dont back their employees up

job_title: Case Manager in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Co-workers are pretty great
cons: Bad pay, hard to build up PTO as they make you use it any time you need off even for family emergencies.

job_title: Front Office Supervisor in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Community support during to insure our clients are receiving the type of services they need to improve there life.
cons: I can't think of any.

review_title: Good salary and benefits, intense work
job_title: Outpatient Therapist in Higginsville, MO
pros: Good salary and benefits include PTO
cons: High workloads, acuity of client conditions, lots of paperwork

job_title: Clubhouse Unit Leader in Saint Charles, MO
pros: This job is amazing, you get so know a lot of amazing people.
cons: Doesn’t seem like much opportunity for advancement. Not a challenging position.

job_title: Community Engagement in Wentzville, MO
pros: Friendly staff, engaged upper management, genuinely cares about the community, clients, and employees.
cons: Depends on your department. I have a wonderful supervisor.

job_title: Medical Office Assistant in Troy, MO
pros: good place to work, pay is comparable to the market
cons: Not always a fair place, not much room for advancement

job_title: Expressive Therapist in Windsor, MO
pros: Very rewarding job, can be fun too.
cons: Poor management, have periods of being really busy , and lulls too.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Charles, MO
pros: Friendly people. Everyone was pretty nice
cons: The pay is horrible and the insurance is 600 a month for a family without spouse.

job_title: RN BSN in El Dorado Springs, MO
pros: Enjoy working with clients and co-workers on unit.
cons: Lack of  consistant administrative support

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Lebanon, MO
pros: Great schedule, family oriented, great staff to work with.
cons: Health insurance is very expensive

job_title: Registered Dental Hygienist in Clinton, MO
pros: Benefits are really good; health, life, bonuses.
cons: Constantly changing and expanding, can be hard to keep up with.

job_title: Health Communications Specialist in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Very flexible with my schedule
cons: Very mentally and emotionally draining

job_title: Customer Relation Specialist in Columbia, MO
pros: Excellent bosses, competitive wages, GREAT benefits.
cons: I don't have any cons.

review_title: Overall Satisfied with Peers and Supervisors
job_title: Community Support Specialist in Raymore, MO
pros: Promotes Employee Health; GREAT benefits!

job_title: Medical Coder Biller in Saint Charles, MO

cons: Medical insurance coverage to high for family

job_title: Hostess in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: Caring staff, fun environment to work

job_title: Customer Service Specialist in Raymore, MO

job_title: Certified Peer Support Specialist in Warrensburg, MO

cons: Management is CRAP, nobody knows one thing from the next.

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Dallas, GA
